rComments: Extremely charismatic and passionate on what he teaches. Hernandez allows for great class discussion and doesn't brush over student's comments allowing for in-depth learning. If you enjoy close reading works definitely take his class!

Professor Alex Hernandez is a gem! He has class take collective notes online, which is an innovative approach to accessibility, it makes keeping your own notes much easier. During lecture he's good at both speaking for a long while, and opening the floor to students to speak their minds. He is also a fairly lenient grader. I 100% recommend him!

My favourite lectures ever, and great office hour feedback. However I also got 5-10% lower essay marks than usual, and he mentioned that he generally doesn't believe in giving marks over 85 - I really liked him but the grading system felt so rigged that I found it really dispiriting. It's worth taking his class, but be sure to buffer your GPA!!

He's a great lecturer with organized slides and well mapped courses. His writing assignments will definitely teach you to be a better researcher and writer. He's very liberal and can be smug, though. I would've enjoyed class a lot more if he hadn't politicized everything.
teacherRatingTags: ['Gives good feedback', 'Get ready to read', 'Clear grading criteria']

rComments: Professor Hernandez is certainly eloquent and highly knowledgable about eighteenth century literature. His lecture slides are very well organized. The strong emphasis on participation (pop quizzes and entries) was a bit excessive compared to similar 300 level courses. Overall, it was certainly not a bad class, but not a memorable one either.

Intelligent, enthusiastic, friendly, hip. His slides are a dynamic collection of images, text, and diagrams that clarify his arguments. Sometimes he is heavy on class discussion, sometimes he takes the reigns and lectures for the whole class, and he is adept at both. He will also recognize you in the street a year later and say hi. A terrific prof.

Super enthusiastic, open to all kinds of opinion on whatever topic we're talking about, very easy to talk to, really  good at keeping discussions focused without accidentally shutting people off. Also pretty funny, good at making a seemingly dull topic interesting and his enthusiasm for the subject is contagious.   Overall a helpful, nice guy.

I liked that he tried to make the seminar as lively as possible and always made us think outside the box when it came to analyzing texts. He's obviously very enthusiastic about whatever he teaches and it shows in his willingness to help whenever possible.
Engaging, upbeat, hip, approachable, Alex's enthusiasm is contagious.
